description: Fleet captain chatter templates organized by activity context

general: Quiet today, boss.
Tunnel's smooth this run.
Ever wonder what's between lanes?
Long haul... I like it.
Still can't believe we made it out of that last one.
Warp field's stable. Nothing to do but wait.
I always liked this part. Just the hum.
Didn't think we'd make it out of that pocket.
That interceptor you clipped back there... clean shot.
Hull's still rattling from that last one.
high_morale: We'll get through this. We always do.
low_morale: We'll... uh... see how this one goes.
I've been thinking... maybe this run isn't for me.

general: Rock's clean. Good vein in this one.
Lasers are holding steady. Should get a full haul.
You ever count how many rocks you've cracked? I stopped at four hundred.
Ore bay's half full already. Not bad for this belt.
Scanner's picking up something dense. Could be worth a closer look.
I swear these asteroids are smaller than they used to be.
Somebody left drill marks on this one. We're not the first here.
Dust keeps clogging the intake. Third time today.
Quiet belt. I don't mind it.
If this vein holds, we're looking at a good payout.
high_morale: This is the kind of haul that makes the trip worth it.
Crew's in good spirits. Steady work does that.
We keep pulling like this, drinks are on me at port.
low_morale: Another rock. Another hour. Another day.
Pay better be worth this dust in my lungs.
I didn't sign up for double shifts in a dead belt.

general: Contact! Bearing two-seven-zero, closing fast.
Shields holding. Keep firing.
Got one! Scratch another off the list.
They're flanking us. Watch the port side.
Missile away. Tracking... tracking... hit!
Hostile down. Scanning for more.
They're running. Should we chase?
Armor's taking hits. Rerouting power to hardeners.
That was close. Too close.
Fleet, focus fire on the lead ship. Bring it down.
high_morale: We've got this. Nobody flies like us.
They picked the wrong fleet to jump.
Keep it up! They're breaking formation.
low_morale: If we make it out of this, I need a drink. A strong one.

general: So... we just waiting, or...?
I reorganized the cargo hold. Twice.
Anyone else hearing that hum from the reactor?
Ran diagnostics. Everything checks out. Again.
You'd think space would be more exciting.
I've been reading the maintenance logs. Riveting stuff.
Docking clamps are getting sticky. Should probably look at that.
How long have we been sitting here?
I made coffee. It's terrible. Want some?
Station comms are playing the same broadcast on loop.
high_morale: Good to have some downtime. We earned it.
Enjoy the quiet. Won't last long with this crew.
Rest up. I've got a feeling the next run's a good one.
low_morale: Sitting here doing nothing doesn't pay the bills.
How long are we grounded? I'm going stir-crazy.
If I have to run diagnostics one more time...

general: Next gate's two jumps out. Smooth so far.
Traffic's light on this route. Good sign.
Passing through low-sec. Keep your eyes open.
Gate fire. Someone just jumped in behind us.
I've run this lane a hundred times. Still don't trust it.
Local count just spiked. Could be a fleet passing through.
Autopilot's fine, but I'd rather fly manual through here.
Fuel's good. We can make it without stopping.
This system always gives me a bad feeling.
Route's clear. Should be an easy run.
high_morale: Good route, good crew. What more do you need?
Almost there. One more jump and we're golden.
This is the life. Open space, full tanks, good company.
low_morale: Every gate could be a camp. Just saying.
Long way from home. Long way from anywhere.
I keep checking the scanner. Can't help it.
